TextENG: Shino darted her hand out in the meantime and grabbed the second man's raised arm. Then she dodged, swept the man's leg out from behind, and easily knocked him to the ground in one fluid motion.

TextJPN: そして、残った最後の男は…。
TextENG: And as for the last man standing...

TextJPN: 「――はぁぁっっ！！」
TextENG: ``...Haaaaaah!!``

TextJPN: いつの間に携えていたのか、桜花は地面を蹴ると手に持った木刀を鋭く前に突き出して、@bあいくち.@<匕首@>を握った手を撃ちつける。
TextENG: Ouka had kicked off the ground and charged at him with a wooden sword in hand, then struck the hand clutching the dagger.

TextJPN: 弾き飛ばされた得物は宙を舞い、少し離れた地面に突き刺さった。
TextENG: The dagger danced through the air and planted itself in the ground a short distance away.

TextJPN: 「…もう一度だけ言います。@k@vS16/47/DS43010410.大人しく従ってください。次は、喉を狙いますよ」
TextENG: ``...Allow me to say it one more time.@k@vS16/47/DS43010410. Please do as we say. I'll go for your neck next.``

TextJPN: 木刀とはいえ、鋭い切っ先を眼前に向けられて、男は思わず息をのんで固まる。
TextENG: Though it was a wooden sword, the man gasped and froze when faced with a sharp object being pointed at him.

TextJPN: さすがにこの暗い中、もっとも当てにくいはずの手を正確に刺突できるのは、相当な腕の持ち主だと理解できたのだろう。…その場にへなへなと崩れ落ち、情けなくうなだれた。
TextENG: He fell to his knees and hung his head pathetically... Even he must have realized how skilled Ouka was to have accurately stabbed a hand that was nearly invisible under the cover of darkness.

TextJPN: 「やるねぇ…桜花。@k@vS16/00/DS43040074.鬼ヶ淵村の巫女さんは、剣術もやるのかい？」
TextENG: ``Damn, you've got skills... Ouka.@k@vS16/00/DS43040074. So Onigafuchi Village's resident miko also knows her way around a sword?``

TextJPN: 「魔央さんも、さすがですね」
TextENG: ``You were impressive yourself, Mao-san.``

TextJPN: 「あははは！　これでも荒事には慣れているしね」
TextENG: ``Ahahaha! I've had plenty of scrapes with punks like these.``

TextJPN: 倒した男を後ろ手に縛りあげながら、魔央はにやりと笑う。そして、志乃は着物についた汚れを打ち払いながら、桜花に向かって『大丈夫？』と何事もなかったように声をかけた。
TextENG: Mao smirked as she tied the men's hands behind their backs. Meanwhile, Shino brushed off some dirt while turning to Ouka and asking ``are you okay?`` as if nothing had happened.

TextJPN: 「私は平気です。@k@vS16/47/DS43010413.お義母さまも、大丈夫ですか？」
TextENG: ``I'm fine.@k@vS16/47/DS43010413. What about you, Mother? Are you all right?``

TextJPN: 「まぁ、これでも村をまとめる立場だから。@k@vS16/00/DS43030345.淑女のたしなみよ」
TextENG: ``Well, I am responsible for a village, appearances aside, so this is only natural.@k@vS16/00/DS43030345. It's a lady's domain.``

TextJPN: …淑女のたしなみに柔術があったなんて話、初めて聞いたのだが。
TextENG: ...First I'd ever heard of jujitsu being a lady's domain.

TextJPN: それにしても、桜花だけでなく鬼ヶ淵村御三家の女性はなんと強いものか。…男顔負けだ。
TextENG: Still, all the women of Onigafuchi's Three Families were tough, huh? ...Ouka's in good company.

TextJPN: 魔央は男たちに近づき、桜花から借りた手拭でその両手を縛り上げる。そして、ひゅうっ、と彼女が指笛を吹き鳴らすと、林の奥から人影が数名立ちあがってきた。
TextENG: Mao approached the men and bound their hands with cloth she borrowed from Ouka. Then she whistled, and several men came out of the forest.

TextJPN: 「あんたたちの出番はなかったみたいだよ、兵吾。@k@vS16/00/DS43040077.ひと暴れできなくて残念だったねぇ」
TextENG: ``Looks like you guys didn't get a chance to shine, Hyougo.@k@vS16/00/DS43040077. Too bad you couldn't cut loose.``

TextJPN: 「…まったく、魔央様にはいつも冷や汗をかかされます。見ているこちらは気が気ではなかったのですよ？」
TextENG: ``...I swear, you're always taking a toll on my heart, Mao-sama. I was on edge just watching you, you know?``

TextJPN: そう言って、兵吾と呼ばれた男は安堵と若干の苦情を込めながら、はぁ、とため息をつく。
TextENG: The man named Hyougo sighed with relief and a hint of complaint.

TextJPN: 彼らは、念のために神社の境内奥に配置していた、魔央の組の若衆だった。
TextENG: These were Mao's men, who had been stationed on the shrine grounds in case something went wrong.

TextJPN: そしてその集団の中には、公由家ゆかりの者も混じっている。…もちろんそれは、双方の疑いを解くためのものであったことは言うまでもないだろう。
TextENG: There were also Kimiyoshi family associates amongst them... Naturally, it went without saying that part of the reason for that was so both groups could clear each other's suspicions.

TextJPN: 「後は任せた。@k@vS16/00/DS43040079.明日の詮議まで、園崎本家の土蔵にでも閉じ込めておいて。@k@vS16/00/DS43040080.…いいだろ、志乃さん？」
TextENG: ``We'll handle the rest.@k@vS16/00/DS43040079. We'll keep them locked up in the Sonozaki estate's storehouse until tomorrow's meeting.@k@vS16/00/DS43040080. ...That work for you, Shino-san?``

TextJPN: 「ええ、よろしくお願いするわ」
TextENG: ``Yes, I would appreciate that.``

TextJPN: 「わかりました。…そら、立てっ！」
TextENG: ``Got it... C'mon, get up!``

TextJPN: 兵吾たち若衆は３人の男を取り囲むように引きたてて、林を出て行く。
TextENG: Hyougo and his associates surrounded the three men, dragged them to their feet, and took them through the forest.

TextJPN: その姿が見えなくなってから、…ふいに桜花はその場にへたり込んだ。
TextENG: Once they were finally out of sight... Ouka suddenly flopped to her feet.

TextJPN: 「ど、どうしたの、桜花っ？！」
TextENG: ``Wh-what's wrong, Ouka?!``

TextJPN: 「いえ、…なんだか、ほっとしてしまって」
TextENG: ``It's nothing... I'm just sort of relieved.``

TextJPN: その返答を聞いて、志乃と魔央は呆れたように顔を見合わせる。
TextENG: Shino and Mao looked at each other in astonishment when they heard that.

TextJPN: そして一瞬、複雑な表情を浮かべて言葉に迷っていたが、…どちらからともなく吹き出し、桜花もそれにならって、笑った。
TextENG: For a moment, they frowned as they tried to think of something to say... but they both chuckled, and Ouka joined in the laughter.

TextJPN: 「…お母さま？」
TextENG: ``...Mother?``

TextJPN: そこへ、笑い声を聞きつけて何事かと思ったのか、風花が怪訝な表情でやってくる。なぜここに、と言いかけた桜花は、その手に鍵があるのを見とがめて、はっと立ちあがった。
TextENG: Just then, Fuuka came over with a puzzled expression, confused about the laughter. Ouka was about to ask what she was doing there, but jolted to her feet as soon as she saw the key her daughter was holding.

TextJPN: 「風花…まさか、あなたが？！」
TextENG: ``Fuuka... No way, it was you?!``

TextJPN: 「あ、あのっ…」
……そして。
TextENG: And so...

TextJPN: 母に問い詰められて、元々素直な性格の風花はあっさりと野犬の母子の世話をするために離れの倉庫を開けたこと、
TextENG: Pressed by her mother, the ever-honest Fuuka quickly confessed to unlocking the warehouse to help feed the dog and her puppies.

TextJPN: そのために鍵を黙って持ち出したことを正直に告白する。
TextENG: As well as taking the key without permission to do so.

TextJPN: それを後ろで聞いていた志乃と魔央は黙って顔を見合わせ、…やがて、ぷっ、と吹き出しながら肩をすくめていった。
TextENG: Shino and Mao looked at each other when they heard this... and soon burst out laughing, shrugging their shoulders.

TextJPN: 「結局、鍵を持ち出していたのは風花だったのね…？」
TextENG: ``So it was Fuuka who took the key, wasn't it...?``

TextJPN: 「なぁんだ…。@k@vS16/00/DS43040084.それがわかっていたら、犯人は素人だって断定できたのにさ。@k@vS16/00/DS43040085.鍵開けの名人でもいるのかと思って、準備が大掛かりになっちまったよ」
TextENG: ``Seriously...@k@vS16/00/DS43040084. We could've figured out right away that the thieves were amateurs if we'd known that.@k@vS16/00/DS43040085. And here we went all-out with the preparations thinking we were up against master lockpickers or something.``

TextJPN: 「ご、ごめんなさい…」
TextENG: ``I-I'm sorry...``

TextJPN: 「風花…もう！@k@vS16/47/DS43010418.　あなたのおかげで、みんなが迷惑したのですよ？」
TextENG: ``Fuuka... Sheesh!@k@vS16/47/DS43010418. You caused trouble for a lot of people!``

TextJPN: 「まぁまぁ、桜花。@k@vS16/00/DS43040087.とりあえず、すべて無事に終わったことだし。@k@vS16/00/DS43040088.…許してやりなよ」
TextENG: ``C'mon, Ouka.@k@vS16/00/DS43040087. No harm no foul, right?@k@vS16/00/DS43040088. ...Let the kid off the hook.``

TextJPN: 「魔央さん…」
TextENG: ``Mao-san...``

TextJPN: そして桜花は、おずおずと申し訳なさそうに志乃にも振り返る。…彼女もしょうがない、と言いたげに肩をすくめ、無言で不問を伝えた。
TextENG: Ouka then turned timidly and awkwardly to Shino... who simply shrugged as if to voice her silent approval.

TextJPN: 「あ、あの…お母さま…」
TextENG: ``U-um... Mother...``

TextJPN: 「まったく、もう…」
TextENG: ``I swear...``

TextJPN: 怒られるのでは、と怯えて縮こまる風花を、桜花はそっと抱き寄せる。そして穏やかな声で『…いけませんよ』と呟き、こつん、と額を合わせてにこやかに笑った。
TextENG: Fuuka curled up in fear she'd get scolded, but Ouka just hugged her gently before saying ``...Don't do it again``, smiling as she softly pressed her forehead against her daughter's.

TextJPN: （とりあえず…雨降って、地が固まったかな）
TextENG: (Well, as they always say... all's well that ends well.)

TextJPN: 今回の一件で、園崎家と公由家の関係も少しは良くなるかもしれない。
TextENG: This incident may have even improved relations between the Sonozaki and Kimiyoshi families.

TextJPN: それを思うと志乃と魔央、そして桜花もまた、風花の悪戯も許せるような気がしていた…。
TextENG: In light of that, the three family heads were rather forgiving of Fuuka's mischief...

TextJPN: 翌朝の古手神社は、多くの村人たちでごった返していた。
TextENG: The next morning, there was a huge crowd of villagers at Furude Shrine.

TextJPN: それもそのはずで、神社の境内には昨夜倉庫に忍び込んだ盗人たちが縛り上げられていたからだ。
TextENG: For that was the place where the thieves who'd snuck into the shrine warehouse the night before were tied up.

TextJPN: 「…あれが、薬を盗もうとしたやつらか？」
TextENG: ``...So those are the ones who tried to steal the medicine?``

TextJPN: 「とんでもない野郎どもだな。鬼ヶ淵村の貴重な宝を盗み出そうなんて…」
TextENG: ``Sick bastards. Can't believe they had the balls to try to steal the village's treasure...``

TextJPN: 口々に非難と罵声を浴びせながら、村人たちは盗人３人を憎悪と軽蔑を込めて睨みつける。
TextENG: The villagers glared at the three thieves with hatred and contempt as they cursed them.

TextJPN: 狭い村ゆえ、倉庫に盗人が入ったことは朝早くにもかかわらず、村全域に知れ渡っていた。その噂を聞きつけて、彼らはその憎き連中を一目見ようと神社に押し掛けてきたのだ。
TextENG: It was a small village, so even though the attempted theft was early in the morning, everyone already knew. Once they heard the rumors, they headed to the shrine to get a glimpse of the criminals.

TextJPN: 「別に、ここまで大仰にしなくてもいいのに。@k@vS16/00/DS43030351.村中に知らせて回ったのは魔央さんなの？」
TextENG: ``They didn't have to make this big of a commotion over it.@k@vS16/00/DS43030351. Was Mao-san the one who spread the word?``

TextJPN: 「ええ、そのようです」
TextENG: ``Yes, so it seems.``

TextJPN: 「はぁ、まったく…」
TextENG: ``Haah, I swear...``

TextJPN: 志乃は苦虫をかみつぶした表情で、大きくため息をつく。
TextENG: Shino heaved a deep sigh with a sour face.

TextJPN: …もっとも、昨夜の一件以来敵対的な雰囲気は薄れており、どちらかといえば近所の娘の悪戯に少し頭を悩ませている、といった様子だった。
TextENG: ...However, her hostility had dialed down since the incident last night, so her response was more akin to hearing about a prank committed by a local girl.

TextJPN: 「…でもお義母さま、どうしてこのような晒しを？@k@vS16/47/DS43010423.　罪人は早急に代官所へ差し出すべきかと思いますが」
TextENG: ``...But Mother, why are they on display like this?@k@vS16/47/DS43010423. I thought criminals were supposed to be promptly sent to the magistrate.``

TextJPN: 「ええ…ただ、ちょっと気になることがあってね。@k@vS16/00/DS43030354.もっとも、ここまで極端にやれとは言っていないんだけど」
TextENG: ``Yes... However, there's still something that concerns us.@k@vS16/00/DS43030354. Not that I think we needed to take it this far, though.``

TextJPN: 庭の隅で、桜花と並んで立つ志乃は衆人環視にさらされる彼らに少々憐れみを覚えたのか、はぁ、とため息をついて見守る。
TextENG: Shino heaved a sigh as she stood next to Ouka by the garden, perhaps feeling a little pity for the thieves for being made a spectacle.

TextJPN: …それでも、今後のことを考えても見せしめが多少必要ではあったので、特に止める気はないようだった。
TextENG: ...But it was necessary to set an example to keep this sort of thing from happening, so she didn't show any signs of stopping it, either.

TextJPN: 私もまた、事の次第を見届けようと二人のそばの庭石に腰を下ろして、縛られた罪人どもを無感動に眺める。
TextENG: I sat down on a rock next to them to oversee the proceedings, and emotionlessly stared at the bound criminals.

TextJPN: そんな私の姿に、唯一気づいている桜花は肩をすくめてみせた。
TextENG: Ouka shrugged when she saw me like that.

TextJPN: 「…とりあえず、まずは自己紹介を。@k@vS16/00/DS43040090.私は園崎家頭首代行、園崎魔央でございます。@k@vS16/00/DS43040091.…どうぞ、お見知り置きを」
TextENG: ``...Anyway, allow me to introduce myself first.@k@vS16/00/DS43040090. I am Mao Sonozaki, acting head of the Sonozaki family.@k@vS16/00/DS43040091. ...Pleased to make your acquaintance.``

TextJPN: そう言って、３人の前に進み出た魔央は深々と一礼して、まっすぐに向き直る。
TextENG: Mao stepped out in front of the three men, bowed deeply, and faced straight ahead.

TextJPN: 言葉だけは丁寧で、礼節を守ったもの。
TextENG: Her words were courteous, and she maintained decorum.

TextJPN: …だが、その響きは酷薄に満ちており、そして鋭利な刃物のようにぎらっと輝くその目に射すくめられて、３人は恐怖と後悔にうち震えながら縮こまっていった。
TextENG: ...However, the three men trembled and shrank back in fear and regret at her callous voice and glare as sharp as a blade.

TextJPN: 「さあ、それでは全て洗いざらい吐いてもらいましょうか…お三方？」
TextENG: ``Now then, gentlemen... what do we say you cough up everything?``

TextJPN: もちろん、３人はうつむいたまま、話すことはないとばかりに押し黙る。そしてそれは、魔央にとっても想定内のことだった。
TextENG: Naturally, the three of them kept hanging their heads as they held their tongues, as if to say they had nothing to talk about... exactly as Mao had anticipated.

TextJPN: 「何も話すことはない、と。@k@vS16/00/DS43040094.…ならば仕方がないですね。@k@vS16/00/DS43040095.兵吾、例のものを用意なさい」
TextENG: ``So you won't say anything, huh?@k@vS16/00/DS43040094. ...Then you leave me with no choice.@k@vS16/00/DS43040095. Hyougo, bring it out.``

TextJPN: 「はい」
TextENG: ``Ma'am.``

TextJPN: その言葉を受け、背後に立っていた兵吾は周囲の取り巻き数名に向かって、無言で頷く。
TextENG: Hyougo, who'd been standing in the back, turned to his nearby followers, and silently nodded.

TextJPN: そして彼らは、そばの植え込みに隠してあった黒い、奇妙な鉄製の器具を持ち出してきた。
TextENG: The men then brought out a bizarre black iron apparatus that had been concealed in a nearby thicket.

TextJPN: あれは、……なんだろうか。
TextENG: What... was that?

TextJPN: おそらく、何かの道具なのだろうが…その用途がわからない。
TextENG: It was probably some sort of tool... but I had no idea what use it served.

TextJPN: 志乃と桜花を見上げてその表情を確かめたが、二人も私と同じ感想のようだった。
TextENG: I looked up at Shino and Ouka to check with them, but it seemed they were just as lost as I was.

TextJPN: 「さて、それではこの道具の説明をしましょうか。@k@vS16/00/DS43040097.…兵吾、それと吾妻、準備を」
TextENG: ``Now then, why don't I explain this device to you?@k@vS16/00/DS43040097. ...Hyougo, Azuma, prep it.``

TextJPN: 二人はどこからともなく、人間そっくりの木の仮面を取り出してくる。
TextENG: The two of them produced wooden masks that looked identical to humans.

TextJPN: その口は裂けそうなほど開かれて、目は苦しみを訴えているようにも見えるつくりをしていた。
TextENG: Their mouths were so wide they looked like they would tear apart, while the eyes had been designed to look as though they were in agony.

TextJPN: 「これは見ての通り、ただの人の形を模した仮面です。@k@vS16/00/DS43040099.まぁ、今からはじめるのはほんの余興なので、あなたたちはじっくり見ていればいい。@k@vS16/00/DS43040100.じっくりと、ね…」
TextENG: ``As you can see, this is simply a mask modeled off a person.@k@vS16/00/DS43040099. Well, what we're about to start is a mere sideshow, so you guys can just sit back and watch every second of it.@k@vS16/00/DS43040100. Every single second...``

TextJPN: そう言って魔央は盗人たちに背を向けて、兵吾たちが掲げてみせる仮面に黒い器具を取り付ける。
TextENG: Mao said that and turned her back on the thieves, followed by Hyougo and Azuma fixing the mask they'd shown off onto the black apparatus.

TextJPN: まるで、顔全体が黒い鉄で覆われているように見えて…なんとも気味が悪い姿だった。
TextENG: It looked as if the whole face was covered in black iron... A rather unpleasant sight.

TextJPN: 「これは元来、歯の治療に使われていた道具です。@k@vS16/00/DS43040102.虫歯を取るとき、あまりの激痛に口を閉じてしまう人のために用意されたものだとのこと」
TextENG: ``This tool was originally used for dentistry.@k@vS16/00/DS43040102. It was made for people who would shut their mouths from the intense pain of getting their cavities removed.``

TextJPN: 「まぁ、口を無理やりこじ開ける道具だと理解していただければ結構。@k@vS16/00/DS43040104.さて…」
TextENG: ``In any case, all you need to understand is that it's a tool for forcing a mouth open.@k@vS16/00/DS43040104. Now then...``

TextJPN: 魔央はおもむろに機械に手をかけて、きゅるきゅると発条仕掛けの取っ手を回しはじめる。
TextENG: Mao suddenly touched the device and began spinning a spin-action lever round and round.

TextJPN: 金属が摩耗する、嫌な響き。…いや、それ以上の光景が、その機械を取り付けた仮面にはあった。
TextENG: The unpleasant echo of metal abrading echoed... No, it was what was happening to the mask fixed to the machine that was worse.

TextJPN: ガコン、…ガコン…。
TextENG: Creak... creak...

TextJPN: 「この開口機の横にある取っ手を回すと、中にある歯車が回転し、口の中を無理やりこじ開ける仕組みになっています。@k@vS16/00/DS43040106.世の中には口が堅くてなかなか開かない、顎の頑丈な方がおりますから」
TextENG: ``By spinning the lever on the side of the device, the gears inside rotate, forcefully prying the mouth open.@k@vS16/00/DS43040106. You see, it's for people with sturdy chins whose mouths won't open so easy.``

TextJPN: 「…そう、あなたたちのような、ね」
TextENG: ``...Yes, just like you three.``

TextJPN: ガコン、…ガコン…。
TextENG: Creak... creak...

TextJPN: 魔央は薄く笑みを浮かべながら、取っ手を回し続ける。
TextENG: Mao faintly smirked as she continued turning the lever.

TextJPN: 気がつけば、さっきまで騒々しかった村人たちは固唾を呑んで、見守っている。…そして盗人たちも、不安に満ちた表情でそれから目を背けることができない様子だった。
TextENG: I only then realized that the previously rowdy villagers were now all watching with bated breath... And the thieves, their faces wrought with worry, couldn't look away from that either.

TextJPN: 「あれは…」
「…ええ」
桜花と志乃は眉をひそめて、顔を見合わせる。…魔央が何を行うつもりなのか、どうやら気づいたようだった。
TextENG: Ouka and Shino frowned and looked at each other... It seemed they'd realized what Mao was planning.

TextJPN: もちろん、私にもその結末が予想できる。
TextENG: I could imagine it too, naturally.

TextJPN: ガコン、…ガコッ…。
TextENG: Creak... creak...

TextJPN: …その時、金属の弾けるような音がして、取っ手の回転が止まる。
TextENG: ...Just then, there was the sound of metal bursting, and the lever stopped.

TextJPN: そして同時に、木の板が裂けるような響きもそれに混じって、はっきり聞くことができた。
TextENG: And at the same time, the sound of the wooden mask splitting could clearly be heard mixed in with that.

TextJPN: 「う…うぅっ？！」
「…おや？@k@vS16/00/DS43040109.　これ以上は進まないのかしら。少し、力をいれてみましょうか――」
TextENG: ``...Oh?@k@vS16/00/DS43040109. Is this as far as it can go? Why don't I try putting a little muscle into it...?``

TextJPN: 魔央はあくまでとぼけたような口ぶりで、腕に力を込める。…その途端。
TextENG: Mao spoke in a way that made it clear she was playing dumb as she filled her arm with strength... Just then...

TextJPN: バキッッ…！！
TextENG: Crack...!!

TextJPN: 木の仮面が真っ二つに裂け、…粉々に砕け散った。
TextENG: The wooden mask split in two... and was smashed to pieces.

TextJPN: 「ひぃぃっっ？！」
TextENG: ``Aaaaaaaaaaaah?!``

TextJPN: 「あ、あぁっ…？！」
TextENG: ``Aah, aaaah...?!``

TextJPN: 「この仮面…壊れてしまったようですね。@k@vS16/00/DS43040111.これが人間だったら…大変なことになりそう。@k@vS16/00/DS43040112.くすくす…さて、そこのお三方？」
TextENG: ``It seems this mask has broken... hasn't it?@k@vS16/00/DS43040111. If that were a human... it probably wouldn't be a pretty sight.@k@vS16/00/DS43040112. Heehee... Now then, gentlemen?``

TextJPN: 「…口を割る？@k@vS16/00/DS43040114.　それとも、口を裂く？@k@vS16/00/DS43040115.　一度しか聞きませんけど」
TextENG: ``...Will you open those mouths?@k@vS16/00/DS43040114. Or do I have to rip them apart?@k@vS16/00/DS43040115. I'm only going to ask once.``

TextJPN: 「い、言います！　全部言います！」
TextENG: ``W-we'll talk! We'll tell you everything!``

TextJPN: 「だ、だからお願いします！　それだけは止めてくださいっ！」
TextENG: ``S-so please! Not that! Anything but that, please!``

TextJPN: 恐怖に屈したように、盗人たちは一斉に叫び出す。
TextENG: The thieves all cried out in submission to fear.

TextJPN: その様子を見ていた村人からは、安堵と、恐怖の溜息が広がっていた。
TextENG: A wave of relieved and fearful sighs spread across the villagers when they saw that.

TextJPN: 私ですら…さすがにこれは少々、やりすぎではないだろうかと感じる。
TextENG: Even I... felt like this may have been going a little too far.

TextJPN: 桜花と志乃も、魔央を見守りながら渋い表情だ。
TextENG: Ouka and Shino were also watching over Mao with grim expressions.

TextJPN: それにしても、どうしてこんな脅迫めいたことを村の皆の前で？
TextENG: Still, why was she doing something so threatening in front of the whole village?

TextJPN: これでは、ただでさえ恐れられている魔央の立場がますます悪くなるだけではないか…。
TextENG: Mao was already feared, so wouldn't this just make her position worse and worse...?

TextJPN: いや…あるいはひょっとして、それも想定しての行いなのだろうか？
TextENG: No, wait... maybe she did this with that idea in mind?

TextJPN: 「…お義母さま、止めますか？」
TextENG: ``...Mother, should we stop it?``

TextJPN: 「いえ、…もう少し、様子を見ましょう」
TextENG: ``No... Let's watch a little longer.``

TextJPN: さすがに嫌悪すら表情に浮かべている桜花に対して、志乃は少し考えてから首を振る。
TextENG: Ouka's face warped in disgust as per her character, but Shino shook her head after thinking a bit.

TextJPN: 脅しの効果はてきめんで、男たちは必死に命乞いをしながら自分の知ることを立て続けに白状していった。
TextENG: The threats had been so effective that the men kept confessing everything they knew, while begging for their lives.

TextJPN: 「お…俺は薬を手に入れたら、金が貰えるって言われたんだ…！　それでこの村に来て、偶然倉庫に運び入れるって話を聞きつけて…」
TextENG: ``I-I was told I'd be paid in gold if I could get my hands on the medicine...! So I came to this village and happened to hear that it was being brought into the warehouse...``

TextJPN: 「俺は、噂を聞いてこの村に来たんだ。そしたらこいつが、薬が手に入るいい方法があるって言うから、それで…！」
TextENG: ``I came here when I heard the rumors. Then this guy told me he had a good plan for obtaining the medicine, and then...``

TextJPN: 「俺は、そいつに誘われて…」
TextENG: ``He invited me...``

TextJPN: 「…ふぅん、なるほどね」
TextENG: ``...Hmm, now I get it.``

TextJPN: 得心したように、魔央は頷く。…首謀者は、どうやら最初に答えた男のようだった。
TextENG: Mao nodded in understanding... It seemed the man who'd answered first had been the ringleader.

TextJPN: …しかし、同時に妙な違和感も覚える。
TextENG: ...But something also struck me as odd.

TextJPN: 桜花の言うとおり盗みを働いたとはいえ、ここで脅迫めいた仕打ちを見せてまでその動機を確かめる必要はないはずだ。
TextENG: Even though Ouka was right about the theft, there should have been no need to put on such a threatening display to ascertain their motives.

TextJPN: いったい魔央たちは、奴らから何を聞き出そうとしているのか…？
TextENG: Just what was it Mao and the others were trying to get out of them...?

TextJPN: 「ならば、聞くよ。@k@vS16/00/DS43040118.大事な質問だ、しっかり答えな。@k@vS16/00/DS43040119.…あんた、誰に頼まれた？」
TextENG: ``Then let me ask you something.@k@vS16/00/DS43040118. This is an important question, so be honest.@k@vS16/00/DS43040119. ...Who put you up to this?``

TextJPN: 「誰に頼まれて、盗みに入ったって聞いてるんだよ…ッ！！」
TextENG: ``I'm asking who told you to carry out the theft...!!``

TextJPN: 先ほどの脅しが児戯にも見えるほどに、魔央は凄みを利かせた睨みで男の顔を、息がかかるほどの至近からのぞき込む。
TextENG: Mao glared ferociously at the man close enough to breathe on him, making her previous threats seem like mere child's play.

TextJPN: その鋭い眼光に射すくめられて、男は愕然と顔を引きつらせながら、目には涙すら浮かべてがたがたと震えだした。
TextENG: The man's face froze in terror at that intense glare, as he started trembling with tears in his eyes.

TextJPN: 「…どういうことですか？」
TextENG: ``...What's the meaning of this?``

TextJPN: 「数人で一攫千金を狙うにしては、数が多すぎる。@k@vS16/00/DS43030358.…つまり、そういうこと。@k@vS16/00/DS43030359.それに、古手家の家紋が入った唐櫃を持ち出したのも気になってね」
TextENG: ``There are too many of them for only a few people aiming to get rich quick.@k@vS16/00/DS43030358. ...That's what this is about.@k@vS16/00/DS43030359. And I'm also concerned about them taking the chest with the Furude crest on it.``

TextJPN: 「では、…お義母さまも魔央さんも、元締めが背後にいる、と？」
TextENG: ``Then... both you and Mao-san think there's someone pulling their strings?``

TextJPN: 「…もっとも、その仮定は確定になりそうだけど」
TextENG: ``...And it would seem that assumption was correct.``

TextJPN: そういって、志乃は険しい表情を浮かべて盗人たちを見据える。
TextENG: Shino said that and sternly stared at the thieves.

TextJPN: 首謀者の男は魔央たちの脅しを受けながら、必死に首を横に振り続けていた。
TextENG: The ringleader frantically shook his head in the face of Mao and her men's threats.

TextJPN: 「ほら、さっさと白状しなよ。@k@vS16/00/DS43040122.…死にたくないだろ？」
TextENG: ``C'mon, cough it up.@k@vS16/00/DS43040122. ...You don't wanna die, right?``

TextJPN: 「し、知らねぇっ！　お、俺は別に、ただのっ、」
TextENG: ``I-I don't know! I-I'm just an ordinary...``

TextJPN: 「ただの…なんだい？@k@vS16/00/DS43040124.　それとも思い出すのに、手伝いが必要かい？」
TextENG: ``An ordinary... what?@k@vS16/00/DS43040124. Or do you need help remembering?``

TextJPN: 「ひ、ひゃぁぁっっ？！」
TextENG: ``A-aaaaaaaaaah?!``

TextJPN: 魔央はそう言って、地面に転がった仮面の破片を男に向かって蹴飛ばしてみせる。それを見て、男は地面に額をこすりつけんばかりに懇願していった。
TextENG: Mao said that and kicked a piece of the mask on the ground over to the man. When he saw that, he dropped his forehead to the ground and started begging.

TextJPN: 「や、やめてくれ！　頼む…口止めされてるんだ！　言ったら、俺が殺される！」
TextENG: ``S-stop! Please... I can't tell you! If I do, they'll kill me!``

TextJPN: 「ほう…なら、殺されないために口を裂くってわけか。@k@vS16/00/DS43040126.それがあんたの選択かい？」
TextENG: ``Oh... then I'll rip your mouth apart so you won't get killed.@k@vS16/00/DS43040126. Have you made your choice?``

TextJPN: 「ひっ…ひぃぃっっ！！」
TextENG: ``Aah... aaaaaaaaaaah!!``

TextJPN: 「も、もうやめて魔央さんっ！」
TextENG: ``S-stop this already, Mao-san!``

TextJPN: 桜花はそう言って、魔央の前に立ち塞がって首謀者の男を庇う。…だが、志乃はその場を動かなかった。
TextENG: Ouka said that and stood in front of Mao, pleading on the ringleader's behalf... But Shino remained where she stood.

TextJPN: 本来ならば、真っ先に魔央の悪行を止めに回るはずの彼女が、なすに任せていたのだ。
TextENG: Normally she'd be the one who'd go to stop Mao's misdeeds right away, yet here she was, letting things play out naturally.

TextJPN: と、いうことは…。
TextENG: Which meant...

TextJPN: （…やはりか）
TextENG: (...I knew it.)

TextJPN: 魔央のこの残酷なふるまいは、すべて計算の上のこと。
TextENG: This cruel act of Mao's was all calculated on her part.

TextJPN: 自分を悪辣に見せることで村人の恐怖をもあおりたて、…その一方で桜花の優しさを際立たせ、彼女に対しての求心度を高めるやり方だった。
TextENG: She would stir the villager's fears by making herself seem vicious... which would highlight Ouka's kindness in contrast, and thereby increase the villagers' unity behind her.

TextJPN: さらに、これを見た村人たちはおそらく、盗みに入ることの恐ろしさを口々に伝え広めるだろう。それによって、この報復は倉庫に忍び込むことへの抑止力ともなるのだ。
TextENG: Furthermore, the villagers who witnessed this would likely spread word about what terror awaited thieves, deterring people from sneaking into the warehouse now that they knew the penalty.

TextJPN: 辛辣で狡猾な手法だが、確かに効果的には違いない。…もっとも桜花は、そこまで察してはいないのだろうが。
TextENG: It was a volatile and crafty method, but certainly effective... Though it seemed Ouka hadn't caught on to it.

TextJPN: 「やりすぎです、魔央さん！@k@vS16/47/DS43010430.　いくらなんでも酷すぎませんか？！」
TextENG: ``You're taking this too far, Mao-san!@k@vS16/47/DS43010430. I know what they have done, but isn't this too cruel?``

TextJPN: 「…酷い？　冗談じゃないよ、桜花。@k@vS16/00/DS43040128.この男は、鬼ヶ淵村の秘薬を盗もうとした悪党だ。許すわけにはいかない。@k@vS16/00/DS43040129.…そうだろ、みんな？」
TextENG: ``...Cruel? Don't make me laugh, Ouka.@k@vS16/00/DS43040128. These men are scoundrels who tried to steal Onigafuchi Village's secret medicine. Like hell we can let that slide.@k@vS16/00/DS43040129. ...Isn't that right, people?``

TextJPN: 「そ、それは…」
TextENG: ``Th-that's...``

TextJPN: 「た、確かにな…」
TextENG: ``Sh-she has a point...``

TextJPN: 村人は躊躇いながらも、口々にそう言って頷き合う。…自分に火の粉が飛んでくることを恐れてのことだろう。
TextENG: Though the villagers hesitated, they nodded and spoke in approval... They were probably afraid of setting off any sparks.

TextJPN: とはいえ、魔央がそろそろ引き際を考えていることは、一瞬だけ浮かべた満足そうな笑みで理解できた。
TextENG: However, I could tell from the satisfied smile that flashed on Mao's face for just a moment that she was thinking about pulling out soon.

TextJPN: 「とりあえず、これでこの人たちも懲りたでしょう？@k@vS16/47/DS43010432.　ならばあとは代官所に任せて、罪に応じた罰を受けてもらうべきです。@k@vS16/47/DS43010433.私たちが彼らに危害を加えることは、この村の掟に反する行為だと思います！」
TextENG: ``They've learned their lesson now, haven't they?@k@vS16/47/DS43010432. So we should just give them up to the magistrate to have them punished for their crimes.@k@vS16/47/DS43010433. I believe that bringing harm to them ourselves would be going against the laws of this village!``

TextJPN: 「なるほどね。それも、一理ある。@k@vS16/00/DS43040131.…おい、あんた」
TextENG: ``I see. You make a fair point.@k@vS16/00/DS43040131. ...Hey, you.``
``Aaah?!``

TextJPN: 魔央は男の髪をつかんで、顔を引き上げる。そして、先ほどまでの睨みから一転穏やかな目に変わり、わずかに笑みすら浮かべて言った。
TextENG: Mao yanked the man's hair and dragged his face up. Then the glare in her eyes softened, and a faint smile rose to her face.

TextJPN: 「桜花の顔に免じて、このへんにしといてやるよ。@k@vS16/00/DS43040133.…感謝するんだね」
TextENG: ``I'll leave it at this, out of consideration for Ouka.@k@vS16/00/DS43040133. ...Aren't you grateful?``

TextJPN: 「あ、あぁ…す、すまね、」
TextENG: ``Y-yeah... th-tha...``

TextJPN: 「…もっとも代官所に行った時点で、あんたたちは裁きを受けることもなく殺されるんだろうけどさ。@k@vS16/00/DS43040135.お気の毒さまだね」
TextENG: ``...Though you'll probably be killed without a trial once you're sent to the magistrate.@k@vS16/00/DS43040135. My condolences.``

TextJPN: 「そ、そんな、嘘だっ！」
TextENG: ``N-no, you're lying!``

TextJPN: この捨て台詞には首謀者の男だけでなく、他の２人も驚愕して目をむく。しかし魔央はあくまで笑みを崩さず、『本当さ』と肩をすくめて淡々と言葉をつづけた。
TextENG: That parting threat caused all three men's eyes to widen in shock. But Mao's smile never faded, and she simply shrugged and casually said ``it's true``.

TextJPN: 「あんたたちは、いわばトカゲの尻尾さ。@k@vS16/00/DS43040137.本当の悪党ってのは自分は傷つかず、分け前はひとり占めにするもんだ」
TextENG: ``You guys are what we call the tail of a lizard.@k@vS16/00/DS43040137. The real villain here will keep their share all to themselves without getting hurt.``

TextJPN: 「…さて、そこで問題だ。@k@vS16/00/DS43040139.雇った相手は、あんたたちが鬼ヶ淵村の連中に捕まったと知ったら、どう思うだろうねぇ？」
TextENG: ``...Now then, here in lies the problem.@k@vS16/00/DS43040139. What do you believe will happen once your employer learns you've been caught by the people of Onigafuchi Village?``

TextJPN: 「きっと、自分の正体を白状しただろう。@k@vS16/00/DS43040141.ならば、さっさと切り捨てて自分は知らぬ存ぜぬを決め込もう、…なんてね」
TextENG: ``He'll surely believe you'll give up his identity.@k@vS16/00/DS43040141. In which case, he will waste no time in getting rid of you and pretending he doesn't know a thing... That's how it'll go.``

TextJPN: 「そ、そんな馬鹿な！　俺は何にも話してねぇぞ！！」
TextENG: ``Th-that can't be! I won't say a thing!!``

TextJPN: 「そんなの、相手の知ったことじゃないよ。@k@vS16/00/DS43040143.まぁ…どう転んでも、あんたの人生はお先真っ暗だ。@k@vS16/00/DS43040144.誰もあんたなんか守っちゃくれない」
TextENG: ``Your employer doesn't give a shit about that.@k@vS16/00/DS43040143. Anyway... your future's looking dim no matter how you spin it.@k@vS16/00/DS43040144. No one's gonna protect the likes of you.``

TextJPN: 「だったら、ここで吐いちまいなよ。@k@vS16/00/DS43040146.今だったら、うちの組でかくまってやってもいい。@k@vS16/00/DS43040147.…これは桜花の目の前での約束だ、私も必ず守ると誓ってやる」
TextENG: ``So in that case, just fess up here and now.@k@vS16/00/DS43040146. If you do, I'll place you under my group's protection.@k@vS16/00/DS43040147. ...This is a promise I make before Ouka, and I swear to keep it.``

TextJPN: 男はうつむいて、額に大粒の汗を浮かべながら押し黙る。
TextENG: The man silently hung his head as large drops of sweat rose to his forehead.

TextJPN: そして、左右の自分の仲間に顔を向け、…連中の哀願するような表情に覚悟を決めたのか、…ぽつり、と小声で呟いた。
TextENG: He then looked at his comrades' faces... and finally, after seeing the pleading looks on their faces, made up his mind... and muttered in a low voice.

TextJPN: 「領主さまだよ…」
TextENG: ``It was the feudal lord...``

TextJPN: それを聞いて、魔央はさすがに驚いたのか息を飲んで絶句する。そして背後に振り返り、怪訝そうに眉をひそめる志乃を慌てて手招きして呼び寄せた。
TextENG: Even Mao couldn't help but gasp in shock and fall speechless when she heard that. She then turned around and quickly gestured Shino over, who was frowning in confusion.

TextJPN: 「どうしたの？　いったい誰が…」
TextENG: ``What's wrong? Who was it?``

TextJPN: 「…領主さまだそうだ」
TextENG: ``...It seems it was the feudal lord.``
``What?!``

TextJPN: 「領主さまの使いが、俺たちのところに来て…薬を盗み出せって、言ったんだ。成功したら、報酬はたんまりはずむって言われて…それで」
TextENG: ``One of the feudal lord's messengers came to us... and told us to steal the medicine. He told us we'd be rewarded beyond our wildest dreams if we succeeded... so...``

TextJPN: それを聞いて志乃も、険しい表情で魔央に目を向ける。そして二人は顔を見合わせながら、どうしたものかと思い悩むように嘆息した。
TextENG: Shino looked at Mao with a grim expression when she heard that. The two stared at each other as they sighed, concerned over what to do.

TextJPN: 「まずいことになったわね」
TextENG: ``This has turned out far worse than we thought.``

TextJPN: 「…あぁ」
「どこぞのお偉方が絡んでいるとは思っていたけど、まさか領主とは…」
TextENG: ``I assumed someone of high standing was behind this, but I never would have suspected the feudal lord...``

TextJPN: 「藪つついて、大蛇ってやつだよ…くそっ！」
TextENG: ``We poked the bush and woke up a dragon... Shit!``

TextJPN: 「…そんなにまずいのですか？」
TextENG: ``...Is it that bad?``

TextJPN: 桜花は状況がよく飲み込めないのか、困惑した様子で二人を見る。それに対して志乃は、話すかどうかを少し考えあぐねてから、ようやく『…ええ』と頷いた。
TextENG: Ouka stared in bewilderment at her fellow heads, clearly not grasping the weight of the situation. Shino hesitated over whether to tell her for a few seconds... but eventually nodded.

TextJPN: 「ここら一帯の領主はね、金もうけのためなら強引なことも平気でやってくるんだ。@k@vS16/00/DS43040154.それこそ言うことを聞かせるためなら、武力さえ持ち出してくるやつさ。@k@vS16/00/DS43040155.…正直、あまりいい話ではないね」
TextENG: ``The feudal lord of this region is not afraid to do anything to make money, no matter how aggressive it may be.@k@vS16/00/DS43040154. He'll even resort to force if it means making others obey him.@k@vS16/00/DS43040155. ...In all honesty, this is really bad.``

TextJPN: 魔央も、黒幕はせいぜいどこかの悪徳商人か、窃盗団の類に見当をつけていたようで、…さすがに動揺を隠せないでいる。
TextENG: Not even Mao could hide how shaken she was... It'd seemed she'd believed the mastermind to just be some immoral merchant or a group of thieves.

TextJPN: 単純に利益を求める連中なら、今日のこの見せしめで余波が自分たちに及ばぬよう、手を引くことを考えるだろう。
TextENG: She'd likely assumed that if the culprits were simply motivated by profit, the aftereffects of today's demonstration would be enough to make them realize they'd been playing with fire and give up.

TextJPN: だが、…相手が権力を持った人間であれば、全くの逆効果だった。むしろ騒動を静めるため、という大義名分を与えることになるからだ。
TextENG: But... that would have the complete opposite effect when the culprit was a man of authority. Instead, he could use this incident as a just cause to suppress strife.

TextJPN: 「ということは…近いうちに来るわね。@k@vS16/00/DS43030367.私たちが決して逆らえないような、『ご命令』が」
TextENG: ``Which means... it'll be coming sooner or later.@k@vS16/00/DS43030367. A decree that we can't defy.``

TextJPN: 「そんな…」
TextENG: ``No way...``

TextJPN: 村の倉庫に押し入った盗人を、捕まえた。
TextENG: The thieves behind the warehouse theft had been caught.

TextJPN: ただそれだけであったはずなのに、…予想を超えた事態が動き出していることを知らされて、桜花は呆然となる。
TextENG: That was all this was supposed to be... yet now that she'd learned the situation was turning in ways that far defied their expectations, Ouka was dumbfounded.

TextJPN: それは、傍らで見守る私も同様だった。
TextENG: That went for me as well.

TextJPN: （やはり…手を出すべきではなかったのか？）
TextENG: (Would it have been better... not to help the village?)

TextJPN: そんな後悔も、今さらとなってはすでに、遅すぎた。
TextENG: It was far too late to regret that now.

TextJPN: 薬の知名度はすでに国外にも広まって、もはやなかったことになどできない。…せめてもの善処策を講じるしか、他に手立てがなかった。
TextENG: Word of the medicine had already spread outside of the nation, so it was too late to pretend it had never happened... All they could do was act cautiously from now on.

TextJPN: 「とりあえず、ここで色々考えていても仕方がない。@k@vS16/00/DS43040157.こいつらは私の方で引き受けるから、志乃さんは薬の配送を予定通りに進めてくれ」
TextENG: ``Anyway, we won't solve anything by standing around here thinking.@k@vS16/00/DS43040157. I'll take care of these guys, so you go ahead with the delivery of the medicine as planned, Shino-san.``

TextJPN: 「わかったわ。@k@vS16/00/DS43030369.…桜花、手伝ってくれる？」
TextENG: ``All right.@k@vS16/00/DS43030369. ...Ouka, will you help me?``

TextJPN: 「あ、はい…」
「大丈夫よ。@k@vS16/00/DS43030371.私たちが、何とかするから」
TextENG: ``Don't worry.@k@vS16/00/DS43030371. We'll figure something out.``

TextJPN: 志乃のにこやかな励ましに、桜花はこくん、と頷く。
TextENG: Ouka nodded at Shino's encouragement.

TextJPN: …ただ、それは彼女の本心からのものであったのかは、私にも、そして志乃たちにもわからなかった。
TextENG: ...But neither me, nor Shino, nor Mao knew if that was how she truly felt.

TextJPN: ただ、私は…。
TextENG: However...

TextJPN: 村人の一部の、若い連中の目が…どうも気になって、仕方がなかった。
TextENG: I couldn't help but be concerned... over the look in some of the young villagers' eyes.

TextJPN: その真意を確かめるため、彼らの後を追ってみようとしたが、…折悪しく桜花に手伝いを頼まれているうち、いつしか私はそのことを忘れてしまっていた。
TextENG: I tried to follow them to figure out what they were up to... but Ouka asked me to help out, and at some point I forgot all about them.

TextJPN: その手抜かりを、私はあとで死ぬほどに悔んだ。
TextENG: I'd come to gravely regret that oversight.
